title: Ticket #116: condor_status complains about argument contradiction based on ordering
description:
If I run 
condor_status -format '%s\n' Machine -master
The response is 
Error:  arg 4 (-master) contradicts arg 1 (-format)
If I swap the arguments: 
condor_status -master -format '%s\n' Machine
I get a list of machines as expected.

Observed behavior: an error message claiming the two arguments are incompatible, when in fact they are compatible.

Expected behavior: the two commands above should emit identical output: the list of machines, one per line.

(Imported from 1694 (backup) 1694 (public)
check_ins:
2010-Feb-25 11:59   Check-in [25323]: Documented fix for condor_status not accepting arguments in some orders. #116 (By Dan Bradley )
2010-Feb-25 11:36   Check-in [17339]: condor_status now accepts -long, -xml, and -format before things like -master. #116 Previously, these attributes had to come after things like -master or the tool would refuse to operate. (By Dan Bradley )
creator: adesmet
